title: Key to the Agathidine (Braconidae) Genera of Thailand

states: with posterior ends directed towards lateral ocelli
with posterior ends directed towards median ocellus
with posterior ends meeting anterior to ocelli forming a complete circle
absent
characters.name: Position of lateral carina of frons

states: quadrate, or slightly narrowing anteriorly
triangular
absent
characters.name: Presence and shape of 2nd submarginal cell of forewing

states: fore and mid claws cleft
fore and mid claws with a basal lobe
Fore and mid claws simple
characters.name: Shape of tarsal claws

states: extensively striate in anterior half or more
not extensively striate, usually smooth or weakly coriarious
characters.name: Sculpture of median tergite 3

states: about as long as basitarsus, and ending in a long thin style
less that 3/4 length of fore basitarsus, and ending abruptly
characters.name: Length of foretibial spurs

states: Mouthparts long, galea significantly longer than wide; gena often elongate
Mouthparts short (normal), galea not longer than wide; gena not especially elongate
characters.name: Length of mouthparts

states: bordered with carinae
not bordered with carinae
characters.name: Frons, with or without lateral carinae

states: mostly striate
entirely smooth
mostly granulate or coriarious
characters.name: Sculpture of first median tergite

states: absent or indicated only by slight swelling
present and distinct
characters.name: Presence of adventitious vein (2RS) on r-m crossvein of forewing

states: short, barely exerted or less than half length of metasoma
longer than half length of metasoma
characters.name: Length of ovipositor

states: present but not necessarily complete
absent
characters.name: Presence of notauli

states: mostly or entirely absent
present and complete
characters.name: Presence of RS+M vein of forewing

states: Hind trochantellus with one or two distinct carinae
Hind trochantellus lacking carinae
characters.name: Presence of ventral longitudinal carinae on hind trochantellus

states: situated entirely dorsal to coxal cavities (CC); wide, high, straight, transverse carinae (TC) between metasomal (MC) and coxal cavities
situated partly between coxal cavities (CC); wide, high, straight, transverse carinae (TC) between metasomal (MC) and coxal cavities absent, usually curved and relatively shallow if present\par{}
characters.name: Position of metasomal cavity (MC) (where the metasoma inserts into the mesosoma)

states: lamellate (high and thin)
in the form of a blunt ridge, not lamellate
absent
characters.name: Shape of lateral carina of frons

states: completely absent
present, though sometimes interupted at midlength
characters.name: Presence of RS vein of forewing

states: present and high, resulting in a deep groove between antennae
absent or low, groove between antennae may be present but not so pronounced
characters.name: Tubular carinae surrounding antennal sockets
